sentences.en: Every morning, take 5 minutes to visualize yourself achieving your goals.
sentences.cn: 每天早上花5分钟,想象你实现了你的目标.

sentences.en: He could not visualize her as old.
sentences.cn: 他想象不出她年老时的样子。

sentences.en: He couldn't visualize either Martinez or Brown as platoon sergeant.
sentences.cn: 他不信马丁内兹和布朗有谁能当得了排里的当家上士.

sentences.en: He described the place and I tried to visualize it.
sentences.cn: 他把那个地方描绘了一遍,我尝试在心中想象那幅图景.

sentences.en: I could visualize how the place must have looked in the past.
sentences.cn: 我可以想象这地方过去准是什么样子.

sentences.en: I could visualize the scene at the time and Mitchell's inscrutability.
sentences.cn: 我可以想象得出当时的情景和米切尔的那种神秘莫测的表情.

sentences.en: I tried to visualize the house while he was describing it.
sentences.cn: 我一边听他描述，一边想象那房子的样子。

sentences.en: It was hard to visualize how it could have been done.
sentences.cn: 很难想象这是如何办到的。

sentences.en: One can visualize this process with the aid of Fig .1.8.1.
sentences.cn: 我们可以借助图1.8.1来看清这种过程.

sentences.en: Operational art requires commanders who can visualize, anticipate, create, and seize opportunities.
sentences.cn: 战役法要求指挥官能够想象 、 预测 、 创造和抓住机会.

sentences.en: She couldn't visualize flying through space.
sentences.cn: 她无法想像在太空中飞行的景象.

sentences.en: This will help you visualize and map the network.
sentences.cn: 这将帮助您可视化和地图网络.

sentences.en: Try to visualize him as an old man.
sentences.cn: 尽量设想他是一位老人。

sentences.en: Users visualize the Undo facility in different ways, depending on the situation and their expectations.
sentences.cn: 取决于各种情况和期望,用户对撤销功能有着不同的形象化理解.

sentences.en: VISUALIZE , STRATEGIZE , ENERGIZE, REALIZE reprogramming is the subject today.
sentences.cn: 可想而知, 策划和推动我们,今天的主题是重新认识.

sentences.en: We begin to see, from this material , how to visualize a waveform from its spectrum.
sentences.cn: 从这些分析中初步看到, 如何从它的谱构思出该波形来.

words.tran_cn: 形象化地；外表上；看得见地
视力；美景；眼力；幻象；想象力
形象化；清楚地呈现在心
视觉型的人；观察仪；想像者
使形象化；想像（visualize的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind

trans.tran_cn: 形成思维图像，设想，使可见
trans.tran_en: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind
